name: JetBrains AI Assistant
tagline: AI features built into JetBrains IDEs
summary:
JetBrains AI Assistant brings AI‑powered code completion, in‑editor generation, chat, unit‑test creation, and explanations into JetBrains IDEs (IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, WebStorm, Rider, and others). It is designed around the way developers work inside JetBrains editors, with AI actions available contextually from the editor, gutter, and tool windows. Documentation covers getting started, licensing, and activation, and includes IDE‑specific guides that show how to use AI Assistant for refactoring, version control workflows, database tools, terminal commands, and more.

JetBrains materials highlight expanding model support and the ability to use certain local models for selected features, while enterprise customers can manage access and usage centrally with JetBrains account/organization tooling. The official YouTube playlists demonstrate practical workflows and “tips & tricks” sessions across languages and frameworks, and the JetBrains Guide collects articles and videos showing everyday patterns for AI‑assisted development in the JetBrains ecosystem.

JetBrains AI Assistant is best for teams already on JetBrains IDEs that want native, discoverable AI functionality without switching editors. Migration typically involves enabling the AI Assistant plugin, obtaining/assigning licenses, and rolling out organization‑wide policies. For teams with strict policies, JetBrains documents configuration, data handling, and options to experiment with local models for specific operations.
models: Multiple models; some features can use local models (per docs)
pricing_notes: See AI Assistant site for current pricing and availability.

cons: Features depend on IDE version and plan

key_differentiators: Local model options for some features
limitations: Requires JetBrains IDEs and AI license
setup_time: Minutes to enable plugin and license
migration_paths: Install AI Assistant plugin; obtain/assign AI licenses
Configure organization policies; optionally try local models for select features
alternatives_notes: Compares with GitHub Copilot in JetBrains and Sourcegraph Cody for JetBrains

reviews.title: Feels built‑in, not bolted‑on
reviews.author: JetBrains community
reviews.body: Playlists and guides show practical in‑IDE usage without leaving the editor.
